intro: Tragacantha hancockii, commonly known as Hancock's tragacanth, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southwestern North America, particularly in parts of Arizona and New Mexico. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by pods containing seeds. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a woody stem that can grow up to several feet in height. Tragacantha hancockii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils.
